intro: Heliotropium ramulipatens, commonly known as the woolly heliotrope, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that range in color from pink to purple, often blooming in clusters at the ends of the stems. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Heliotropium ramulipatens is valued for its ornamental appeal and is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
